edu.stanford.nlp.mt.tools

Class PrefixTagger

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.nlp.tagger.maxent.TestSentence
      • edu.stanford.nlp.mt.tools.PrefixTagger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.stanford.nlp.sequences.SequenceModel

    public class PrefixTagger
extends edu.stanford.nlp.tagger.maxent.TestSentence
    Greedy prefix tagger. Its search is exact iff the tagging model is non-sequential (i.e., does not condition on contextual class labels) and only looks at the current word and a left context of prefixSize words to determine the best tag.
    Author:
    Michel Galley

    • Constructor Detail

      • PrefixTagger

        public PrefixTagger(edu.stanford.nlp.tagger.maxent.MaxentTagger maxentTagger,
            int leftWindow,
            int rightWindow)
        Creates a new PrefixTagger. Since PrefixTagger can't determine how many words of context are needed by the tagging model, leftWindow must be manually specified.
        Parameters:
        maxentTagger - general information on the tagger (this parameter will soon change)
        leftWindow - How many words to the left determine the current tag.

        Parameters:
